intro: Acerates latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed maple, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant colors in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
